availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: P. H. Watson (Washington, D. C., patent agent and assistant to the secretary of war)

body.p: Washington, D. C., patent agent and assistant to the secretary of war. Native of England. Married to Rose R. Watson. Father to Chas Watson, Edward Watson, Ellen Watson, Leonard Watson. Patent agent in Washington, D. C. in 1860. Employed Alice Williams, William H. Thomas, Pauline Gunnell, Mary A. Butler in Washington, D. C. 1860. Assistant to the secretary of war in 1862.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, District of Columbia, Washington, p. 58.
